thread.title: The Pulse: Adelaide’s live news, weather and traffic blog |
thread.title_full: The Pulse: Adelaide’s live news, weather and traffic blog | The Advertiser

author: Michael Ramsey
title: The Pulse: Adelaide’s live news, weather and traffic blog |
text:
PATRICK Dangerfield says he hasn’t decided whether he’ll be at West Lakes next season, saying his focus is on getting the Crows to the finals.
With rumours swirling that Adelaide could be set to announce the gun midfielder’s re-signing as he met with manager Paul Connor yesterday, Dangerfield said contract talks had been the last thing on his mind in recent weeks.
“In terms of meeting to discuss next season, that meeting hasn’t happened,” he told 5AA this morning.
“It’ll happen eventually but to be honest, the last couple of weeks my priority has been performing and making sure our group is in the best possible shape to perform on matchday.
“To be honest it really has been the absolute last thing on my mind.
“Given the position that we’re in - we’re quite precarious in terms of where we’re sitting (on the ladder) - we need to win every game. It’s quite easy to just focus on footy because one slip-up and it could really cost us at the end of the season.”
Dangerfield admitted he was still attracted by the lure of reuniting with his family in Moggs Creek in Victoria but said he also had strong emotional ties to West Lakes.
“It’s one family over another almost. That’s what the Adelaide footy club has become over the last eight years,” he said.
“My feeling towards the club hasn’t changed, I still love the place. But I just haven’t made the decision yet because it just hasn’t been of huge importance to me, basically.”
The Pulse has this story today as well as other breaking news and all your traffic and weather updates.
So stay with us, we’re blogging live until 10am. Remember, if you can’t find the story you’re looking for, scroll down.
And you can join the conversation by tweeting us using the hashtag #newsADL or leaving a comment below.
